page.title: 19Leigh on Mendip amenities.
page.content: THE CHURCH combines with nearby Stoke St Michael for services. There is a Sunday School once a month. THE SCHOOL has 32 children aged 4 to 9yrs and two teachers. The building is 120 years old with outside toilets. THE BELL INN is the only public house. It is a 16th century building and has a restaurant and skittle alley. THE VILLAGE HALL is on the housing estate opposite the pub. It is used for the old people's club, the W.I., a Mother's and Toddlers group, jumble and other sales and discos. There is no youth-club or other young-people's organisations. THE RECREATION GROUND is used for football and cricket and for the annual village fete. There is also a SOCIAL CLUB.
